channel.title: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi

item.title: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“haviland4, post:4, topic:541406”]could someone help me please??

i still cant seem to add custom items to my server…

skype:haviland41[/quote]Yet you seem to think your server is worth selling…

Like I said, in the forID method in ItemDef.java (client sided obviously) add the ints (everything you put in the OP) with the rest of them. If you really can’t find it, post your ItemDef.java in code brackets or on pastebin.
Also, if your client has a second itemdef (Like ItemDef_2 or something) chances are you’re going to have to put it in there.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi

item.title: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Custom objects and custom items are TOTALLY different. Please make sure to ask for the right one…
Also, that code is added into ItemDef (or ItemDef_2, etc) in the forID method…

Read full topic
item.source: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi

item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Look for wherever has a similar block of content (ie search for itemDef.modelRotationY).

Read full topic

item.title: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

[center][b]Hey guys i want to add a custom object to deathlypvpz v4.1 but cant seem to find out where abouts to add the code.

here is the case object i want to add its custom wings.
i know how to add the object to the raw folder etc but no idea where to place this code i did look into the itemdef no not sure where abouts.[/b]

case 11608: itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[5]; itemDef.newModelColor = new int[5]; itemDef.modelid = 23231; itemDef.modelZoom = 1250; itemDef.modelRotationY = 250; itemDef.modelRotationX = 0; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -6; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 1; itemDef.anInt204 = 14; itemDef.anInt165 = 23232; itemDef.anInt200 = 23232; itemDef.anInt175 = -1; itemDef.anInt197 = -1; itemDef.name = "Rainbow Wings"; itemDef.description = "Its Rainbow Wings."; break;

[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: Help with adding custom objects 317 pi
